metadata.title: CVE-2020-10711 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel's SELinuxsubsystem in versions before 5.7. This flaw occurs while importing theCommercial IP Security Option (CIPSO) protocol's category bitmap into theSELinux extensible bitmap via the' ebitmap_netlbl_import' routine. Whileprocessing the CIPSO restricted bitmap tag in the 'cipso_v4_parsetag_rbm'routine, it sets the security attribute to indicate that the categorybitmap is present, even if it has not been allocated. This issue leads to aNULL pointer dereference issue while importing the same category bitmapinto SELinux. This flaw allows a remote network user to crash the systemkernel, resulting in a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10711` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-4.4.0-185-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-generic - 4.4.0-185.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-185-lowlatency - 4.4.0-185.215
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-107-generic - 4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-107-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-107-lowlatency - 4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-107-generic - 4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-107-lowlatency - 4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1076-kvm - 4.4.0-1076.83
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-aws - 4.4.0-1110.121
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1074-aws - 4.15.0-1074.78~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1091-azure - 4.15.0-1091.101~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1078-gcp - 4.15.0-1078.88~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1046-oracle - 4.15.0-1046.50~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1135.144
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1139.147
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-185.215').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-107.108~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.83').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1110.121').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1074.78~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.101~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1078.88~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1046.50~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.144').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.147').
